ARCHMAGE.byAction: Группировать по наличию действий у умения
ARCHMAGE.helpCompact: Inline rolls allowed here.
ARCHMAGE.helpDetailed: Use inline rolls such as [[d20+@str.mod+@std+@atk.a.bonus]] vs AC to insert dice rolls wherever you need them. Any roll formula will work!
ARCHMAGE.name: Имя

SETTINGS.automateBaseStatsFromClassHint: Автоматически заполнять КБ, ФЗ, МЗ, базовые ПЗ, кости восстановления и оружия в зависимости он названия класса.
SETTINGS.automateHPConditionsHint: Потрясение и Смерть будут автоматически выставляться и удаляться при изменении ПЗ. Если вы используете сторонние модули для управления состояниями, вроде CUB, то это включать не нужно.
SETTINGS.ColorblindHint: Изменяет цвета карт умений в совместимую с дальтонизмом палитру.
SETTINGS.ColorblindIssuesMessage: We're always trying to improve our accessibility. Suggest accessibility improvements at our issue tracker and include the a11y label.
SETTINGS.allowPasteParsingHint: If enabled, the system will attempt to parse clipboard contents for dice rolls before pasting them into fields on power sheets and monster action sheets.
SETTINGS.hideExtraRollsHint: Если включено, силы с несколькими атаками будут отображаться как одна атака на каждую цель.
SETTINGS.hideInsteadOfOpaqueHint: Включите, если вы не хотите видеть неактивные особенности.
SETTINGS.hideInsteadOfOpaqueName: Скрывать неактивные особенности / триггеры вместо затенения.
SETTINGS.initiativeDexTiebreakerHint: Если инициатива равная, то ничья будет разрешена модификатором. Иначе монстр побеждает по умолчанию.
SETTINGS.initiativeStaticNpcHint: If enabled NPC actors will always 'take 10' on initiative rolls.
SETTINGS.multiTargetAttackRollsHint: Если включено, то атака будет произведена против всех выбранных целей.
SETTINGS.nightmodeHint: Reverse the sheet color scheme into a darkened night mode.
SETTINGS.compactModeHint: Scales down the character sheets to be smaller.
SETTINGS.rechargeOncePerDayHint: Перезаряжать умения только один раз при коротком отдыхе (вкл) или каждый раз при коротком отдыхе (выкл)?
SETTINGS.resetIconsOnRestHint: Automatically clear icon relationship results (advantages, uses) on a full heal-up.
SETTINGS.resetIconsOnRestName: Reset Icon Relationships on Full Heal-Up
SETTINGS.RoundUpDamageApplicationHint: Будет применяться одинаково как для персонажей, так и для NPC
SETTINGS.RoundUpDamageApplicationName: При нанесении урона через меню ПКМ, округлять урон в большую (вкл) или меньшую сторону (выкл)?
SETTINGS.allowTargetDamageApplicationHint: Whether or not to allow damage and healing on chat messages to be applied to targeted tokens in addition to selected tokens. Targeting does not require permissions, so this can allow players and GMs to apply damage to ANY token they can see.
SETTINGS.allowRerollsHint: Whether or not to allow non-GM players to reroll their own dice rolls.
SETTINGS.secondEditionHint: Turn this on to use the 13th Age second edition rules, off if you'd prefer the first edition rules.
SETTINGS.alternateIconRollingMethodHint: Turn this on to use Jonathan's alternate icon rolling method, which allows you to roll for icons in the moment instead of at the start of the arc.
SETTINGS.showDefensesInChatHint: Если включено, показатели защиты цели будут отображаться в карточке чата при атаке.
SETTINGS.showDefensesInChatName: Показывать показатели защиты цели в чате
SETTINGS.showNaturalRollsHint: Enable this to display natural dice results for d20 rolls in chat power cards.
SETTINGS.showNaturalRollsName: Show natural d20 rolls in chat
SETTINGS.showVulnsInChatHint: Detects when an attack target is vulnerable (and to what type of attacks). This will reveal monsters' vulnerabilities to players.
SETTINGS.staggeredOverlayHint: Состояние Потрясения будет автоматически выставляться оверлеем на токене вместо обычной иконки статуса.
SETTINGS.sheetTooltipsHint: Adds tooltips to sheets containing relevant SRD rules and tips. May be most useful when first learning the system or for the GM who only references player sheets occasionally. Client setting.
SETTINGS.showPrivateGMAttackRollsHint: Shows 3D dice and their result for item/attack rolls to players when the GM's roll mode it set to "Private GM roll". Only the dice are shown, not the chat cards. Dice rolls may be useful to know for players (in cases such as the Fighter's Counter-Attack).
SETTINGS.showPrivateGMAttackRollsName: Show 3D dice for private GM rolls
SETTINGS.tourVisibilityHint: При обновлении Toolkit13 будет отображаться тур по изменениям. Вы можете настроить кто будет видеть этот тур (или отключить его).
SETTINGS.UnboundEscDieHint: Включите, чтобы кость эскалации могла быть выше 6 и ниже 0 при ручном изменении (лимит остаётся при автоматической смене раундов).
SETTINGS.enableOngoingEffectsMessagesHint: Enable chat messages for ongoing effects on actors at the start and end of their turns.

lifecycleHooks.title: Lifecycle Hooks
lifecycleHooks.hint:
These macros will run on this character's owner's client. If that player is not logged in, they will not be executed.

In the body, available arguments are this, speaker, actor, and archmage.

AUTOLEVEL.help: Use this form to create a copy of this actor with its stats (including attacks) adjusted to the new level.

RESOURCES.rerollAcDesc: Reroll an attack that targeted your AC

CHARACTERFLAGS.averageRecoveriesHint: Average results for recovery rolls instead of rolling them.
CHARACTERFLAGS.diceFormulaModeHint: Method used to display inline dice formulas on power previews in the character sheet.
CHARACTERFLAGS.hideCurrencyHint: Hide the currency section in the inventory.
CHARACTERFLAGS.hideEmptyPowerGroupsHint: Hide empty Power groups on the sheet (besides the default one).
CHARACTERFLAGS.hideImportPowersHint: Hide the Import Powers button for players.
CHARACTERFLAGS.hideOneUniqueThingHint: Hide the One Unique Thing section.
CHARACTERFLAGS.hideSettingsTabHint: Hide the sheet settings tab for players.
CHARACTERFLAGS.implacableHint: Paladin talent to roll saves at the start of your turn instead of at the end of your turn.
CHARACTERFLAGS.initiativeAdvHint: Человеческая черта, позволяющая бросить 2d20 для инициативы и оставить лучший результат.
CHARACTERFLAGS.dexToChaHint: Paladin feature to use Cha in place of Dex for AC calculation.
CHARACTERFLAGS.dexToIntHint: Wizard talent to use Int in place of Dex for AC, PD and initiative calculations.
CHARACTERFLAGS.grimDeterminationHint: Barbarian feature to get extra defences when you have one or more skulls.
CHARACTERFLAGS.overridePowerLevelHint: Automatically upgrade power's (e.g. spell's) level to your character's level when using it.
CHARACTERFLAGS.portraitFrameHint: Whether or not the character portrait has a white frame and shadow on the V2 sheet.
CHARACTERFLAGS.portraitRoundHint: Whether or not the character portrait is rounded on the V2 sheet.
CHARACTERFLAGS.strongRecoveryHint: Universal feat to improve your recovery rolls.

DURATION.StartOfNextTurnFull: until the start of the target's next turn
DURATION.StartOfNextTurnFull2: until the start of its next turn
DURATION.EndOfNextTurnFull: until the end of the target's next turn
DURATION.EndOfNextTurnFull2: until the end of its next turn
DURATION.StartOfNextSourceTurnFull: until the start of your next turn
DURATION.EndOfNextSourceTurnFull: until the end of your next turn
DURATION.EndOfRoundWarning: No active combat, cannot determine end of round; assuming first round.

INCREMENTALS.classFeatureHint: If you have a class feature that improves every level, bump up its effective level by one
INCREMENTALS.extraMagicItemHint: Позволяет носить дополнительный волшебный предмет без перенапряжения от Странностей
INCREMENTALS.featHint: Выберите одну черту, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.featureHint: Выберите особенность класса, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.hpHint: Повышает ваши ПЗ как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.mdHint: Increase your MD by one, as if you were one level higher
INCREMENTALS.pdHint: Increase your PD by one, as if you were one level higher
INCREMENTALS.powerSpell1Hint: Выберите умение / заклинание, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.powerSpell2Hint: Выберите умение / заклинание, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.powerSpell3Hint: Выберите умение / заклинание, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.powerSpell4Hint: Выберите умение / заклинание, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.powerSpellHint: Выберите умение / заклинание, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.talentHint: Выберите один талант, как если бы вы были на уровень выше
INCREMENTALS.recoveryHint: Gain extra recovery dice as if you were the next level
INCREMENTALS.skillInitiativeHint: Add +1 to all skill and initiative checks
INCREMENTALS.abilMultiplierHint: Double/quadruple the ability modifier contribution to damage and healing (4th/7th level)

ICONROLLS.rollDialogHint: Roll dice for {name} only, or for all icons?
ICONROLLS.noDiceLeft: You have no icon dice left to roll.

CUP.title: 13th Age Community Use Policy
CUP.content: This system for Foundry VTT uses trademarks and/or copyrights owned by Fire Opal Media Inc., which are used under the Fire Opal Media Inc., 13th Age Community Use Policy. We are expressly prohibited from charging you to use or access this content. This system for Foundry VTT is not published, endorsed, or specifically approved by Fire Opal Media.

PREPOPULATE.help: Отметьте умения, которые вы желаете добавить, а затем нажмите Применить для добавления их персонажу. Вы можете нажать на название умения, чтобы развернуть его полное описание.

ITEM.critDefBonusHint: +1 means something that would crit you on 20 crits you on 19+, etc.
ITEM.critModBonusHint: +1 means you would crit on 19+, etc.
ITEM.group: Элементы одной группы будут сгруппированы вместе
ITEM.ongoingDamageCrit: Ongoing Damage is from a critical hit
ITEM.usesMaxHint: Number of uses per battle/day, usually 1
ITEM.usesRemainingHint: Number of remaining uses, usually the same as Max Uses

CHAKRA.noBonus: No default bonus, depends on the item
CHAKRA.staffBonus: Operates as both a Wand and a Symbol
CHAKRA.symbolBonus: Default Bonus: Divine Attack and Damage
CHAKRA.wandBonus: Default Bonus: Arcane Attack and Damage

CHAT.alwaysTitle: Effects that always happen, regardless of circumstances or rolls
CHAT.attackTitle: Attack formula, such as "[[d20+@str.mod+@std]] vs. AC"
CHAT.critModTitle: Critical hit range modifier, such as "3" or "[[@ed]]"
CHAT.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this?
CHAT.effectTitle: General effect of a spell or power when it's used.
CHAT.FullHealBody: Восстановить всё здоровье, перезарядки и использования умений.
CHAT.groupTitle: Custom group used to organize this on character sheets.
CHAT.hitTitle: Effects on successful hit, for example "[[@wpn.m.dice+@str.dmg]] damage"
CHAT.hit2ValuePlaceholder: Make a *screeching wail* attack as a free action.
CHAT.hitEvenTitle: Effects that happen on even hits
CHAT.hitOddTitle: Effects that happen on odd hits
CHAT.embeddedMacroSummary: Edit the embedded macro that will be run on use.
CHAT.embeddedMacroSummaryTooltip: The macro will be run if the item is used/rolled. Context is passed as arguments.
CHAT.embeddedMacroPermissionError: Cannot execute embedded macro - request permission for this user to your GM!
CHAT.missTitle: Effects that happen on a miss, such as "Damage equal to your level ([[@lvl]])"
CHAT.missEvenPlaceholder: Effects that happen on even misses
CHAT.missOddPlaceholder: Effects that happen on odd misses
CHAT.NoUsesMsg: Не осталось использований. Всё равно использовать?
CHAT.ongoingSelfEnded: The following Effects have ended on this Actor
CHAT.ongoingOtherEnded: The following Effects have ended on another Actor
CHAT.ongoingSaveEnds: The following Effects require a Save to end
CHAT.ongoingSelfTriggered: The following Effects triggered on this Actor
CHAT.hasUnknown: The following Effects with an unknown duration are currently active on this Actor
CHAT.powerLevelTitle: Adjusting the power level will affect which level effects get sent to chat.
CHAT.powerSourceTitle: The source this power was gained from (e.g. Wizard).
CHAT.powerSourceTypeTitle: The type of source this power was gained from.
CHAT.powerOriginTitle: Original power name when the power's name is customized for any reason (such as the wizard's polysyllabic verbalizations talent).
CHAT.QuickRestBody: Восстановить умения с ограниченным использованием за бой, совершить проверку перезарядки умений и восстановления здоровья выше 50%.
CHAT.rangeTitle: Range of the power, such as 'Meele attack' or 'Ranged spell'
CHAT.rechargeHint: Numbers only, such as '16' (recharges on a roll of 16+)
CHAT.resourcesTitle: Enter a positive or negative number and a resource name that matches one of the resources on your character sheet, such as "-2 command points"
CHAT.specialTitle: Special conditions to use the power.
CHAT.sustainedOrFinal: Do you want to use the Final Verse instead of the Sustained Effect?
CHAT.rollTableTitle: Name of a roll table to roll on use (only text supported)
CHAT.sustainOnTitle: Numbers only, such as '16' (is sustained on a roll of 16+)
CHAT.targetTitle: Targets for this power, such as "[[1d3]] nearby enemies", determines how many attacks are rolled
CHAT.triggerTitle: Trigger for this power, such as 'Natural even miss'
CHAT.vulnerableTooltip: The “vulnerable” condition is present but a type is not specified.

TARGETING.crescendoSpecial: You can choose more than one target for this spell, but you take a –2 penalty when attacking two targets, a –3 penalty for three targets, and so on.

UI.errMacroSyntax: There was an error in your macro syntax. See the console (F12) for details.
UI.errNotEnoughBravado: You don't have enough Bravado to use this power. Use anyway?
UI.errNotEnoughCP: У вас не достаточно Пунктов Приказа для этого приказа. Всё равно использовать?
UI.errNotEnoughKi: У вас не достаточно Ки для этого умения. Всё равно использовать?
UI.errNoMomentum: У вас не достаточно Импульса для этого умения. Всё равно использовать?
UI.errNoFocus: У вас не достаточно Фокуса для этого умения. Всё равно использовать?
UI.errNoRecoveries: You don't have any recoveries left. Use anyway?
UI.errNoRhythm: You need to enter your Combat Rhythm to use this power. Use anyway?
UI.errNoInitiativeOutsideCombat: Can't roll initiative without an encounter in the combat tracker.
UI.errOnlyTextRolltables: Only text Roll Tables are supported for now.
UI.infoDesperateTriggeredEmpty: You triggered your desperate recharge for this arc, but there was nothing to recharge.
UI.warnStatusEffect: Effect data empty, can't apply this effect.
UI.warnMacroOnlyOwnedItems: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items.
UI.warnMacroItemNotFound: Could not find item {item}. You may need to delete and recreate this macro.
UI.warnMacroItemNotOnActor: Your controlled Actor does not have an item named {item}.
UI.tooManyLevels: Изменение монстра на более чем 6 уровней не рекомендуется.
UI.levelLimits: Уровень не может быть выше 15 и ниже 0.
UI.classChange: Класс изменён, базовые показатели будут обновлены.

MIGRATIONS.start: Applying 13th Age System Migration version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATIONS.complete: 13th Age System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATIONS.1_19_0: 13th Age 1.19.0: Updating NPC initiative to use a flat number and not calculate it based on level.
MIGRATIONS.1_24_0: 13th Age 1.24.0: Updating PC initiative to remove the Improved Initiative flag.
MIGRATIONS.1_25_0: 13th Age 1.25.0: Updating Powers cost field to new resources syntax.
MIGRATIONS.1_30_0: 13th Age 1.30.0: Updating NPC actors to separate Size and Strength.
MIGRATIONS.1_36_0: 13th Age 1.36.0: Updating PC actors to remove Toughness flag.

TOOLTIP.portrait:
Portrait image.
Click to edit (may need permissions).
TOOLTIP.pcAbility: Ability Scores (or Abilities) are distributed during character creation to fit the character you want to portray and can be increased upon reaching certain levels. The Modifier (or Mod) is derived from this value. The character level acts as a bonus.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitySuffix: Click to roll a Skill Check based on this ability. You can optionally apply a Background and Situational Bonus in the roll dialog.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitystr: Strength represents bodily power and capacity for force. It's used for melee attack and damage rolls (for most classes), Skill checks (whether for athletic activities, physical intimidation or other things) and Physical Defense (PD). Especially important for Fighters, Barbarians and Paladins.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitycon: Constitution represents toughness, endurance and stamina. It's used for character determining Hit Points, Armor Class (AC), Physical Defense (PD) and Skill Checks (for things that require endurance). This is important for all classes (except Necromancers).
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitydex: Dexterity represents hand-eye coordination, agility, reflexes and balance. It's used for ranged attack and damage rolls (with weapns, for most classes), Armor Class (AC), Physical Defense (PD) and Skill Checks (for things like picking locks, balancing or sneaking). Most important for Rogues, and anyone who wants to be a skilled archer.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilityint: Intelligence represents capacity for analytical and abstract thought and the ability to recall knowledge. It's used for Mental Defense (MD), Skill Checks and spellcasting for some classes, like Wizards and Necromancers.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitywis: Wisdom represents intuiton, insight and perceptiveness, being in tune with and aware of one's surroundings. It's used for Mental Defense (MD), Armor Class (AC), Skill Checks (like determining an NPCs motivation, healing the wounded or Stabilizing an unconscious ally) and spellcasting for some classes, like Clerics and Druids.
TOOLTIP.pcAbilitycha: Charisma represents social grace and force of personality. It's used for Mental Defense (MD), Skill Checks (like bluffing or influencing people, pretending to be someone else, intimdating people or handling animals), spellcasting for some classes (like Sorcerer) and Paladin class features.
TOOLTIP.pcBackground: {desc} Backgrounds represent pieces of a character's history and experience. It helps to keep Backgrounds broad enough to encompass multiple skills while being specific enough to connect your character to the world – to a region, faction, people or goal. The sheet options can be used to hide unused backgrounds or to add more. Click the die icon to roll a check based on this background. You can choose which Ability to use and optionally apply a Situational Bonus in the roll dialog.
TOOLTIP.pcClass: Character class (for example, "Fighter") Determines things like available talent, powers, feats and base stats. Also provides a +2 bonus to one of your ability scores. Base stats are adjusted automatically when this field is edited. For this to work, the spelling must match exactly. You may want to adjust whether you use a shield, a two handed weapon or dual wielding in the sheet settings. For custom classes, stats need to be set in the sheet settings manually. Foundry modules can add more classes. For multiclassing, multiple class names can be used, like "Fighter/Barbarian". You may need to adjust the key modifiers to use in the sheet settings.
TOOLTIP.pcDeathSaves: Dying player characters (at 0 HP or below) need to make Death Saves at the start of each of their turns and can't take other actions. Death saves are a Hard (16+) save. On success, use a recovery to return to consciousness and recover HP. On a natural 20, you can also act normally during that turn. On a 15 or less, you take one step toward the grave. After the fourth failed death save in a single battle, you die. You also die when you reach negative HP equal to half your maximum HP or when running out of Last Gasp saves. A dying character can be stabilized with a DC 10 healing skill check using Wisdom as a Standard Action, which is wasted on failure. On a 25+, the check becomes a Quick Action instead. Feeding a dying character a healing potion gets them conscious and back on their feet, but always takes a Standard Action. Death saves only reset after a battle (Foundry handles this during Quick Rest).
TOOLTIP.pcDefenses: Armor Class (AC) is based on the middle value of Strength, Dexterity or Wisdom. Protects against weapon attacks, both melee and ranged. Physical Defense (PD) is based on the middle value of Strength, Constitution or Dexterity. Protects from other physical attacks, like many spells. Mental Defense (MD) is based on the middle value of Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma. Protects against mental attacks, like many spells. Effects and attacks need to meet or beat these values. Exact values are determined by class, the relevant ability modifier and character level.
TOOLTIP.pcEngagement: In battle, everyone is either engaged or unengaged (free). Allies engaged with the same foe are considered next to each other. Free characters can move freely, use ranged attacks, etc. If they try to move past a free foe, that foe usually has the option to intercept them (which engages them and usually stops the movement for this turn). Free characters can't use melee attacks or close-quarter attacks until they engage. Engaged characters are in meele with one or more foes. They can use melee attacks and close-quarter spells against those foes. They can use ranged attacks and non-close-quarters spells, but draw opportunity attacks from all foes that are engaging them that aren't targets of the attack. Moving away also draws opportunity attacks from all engaged foes. Opportunity Attacks are single basic melee attacks made as a free action. You can use your Move Action to Disengage. This is a Normal (11+) save. On a success, you disengage and can move normally without drawing opportunity attacks. If you fail, you don't move and lose your move action for that turn and remain engaged, but don't take any opportunity attacks either.
TOOLTIP.pcHitpoints: Hit Points are determined by class, constitution modifier and level. Hit Points are an abstraction around health, stamina and will to fight. Every creature has hit points. Player characters (and often enemies) are Staggered at half of their hit points and below, at which point some powers, spells, monster attacks and other things work differently. You slay (or knock out) enemies at 0 HP. Player characters fall Unconscious and can't take any actions besides rolling a Death Save, which they need to do at the start of each of their turns. Hover over Death Saves for more information. You can have negative HP, so you still take damage at 0 HP. When you reach half your maximum Hit Points, you die instantly. Negative Hit Points are ignored when healing and using recoveries. Always start counting from 0 then. Hit Points can be regained by using Recoveries, Potions and some spells and powers. A Full Heal-Up resets HP back to full. When Leveling Up (or taking the Incremental Advance for Hit Points), your current Hit Points increase by the same amount as your Maximum Hit Points. Temporary Hit Points don't stack and are used up before normal Hit Points. They reset to 0 when rolling initiative and after each battle.
TOOLTIP.pcIconRelationship: Icons are the most known and important NPCs and their factions in your campaign. Your character's relationship to some of these icons (whether positive, negative or conflicted) will result in occasional Advantages (sometimes with Complications attached). Click to roll icon dice, one per relationship point. For each point, Foundry shows a small symbol you can click to toggle between used (or empty), 5 (Complicated Advantage) or 6 (Unambiguous Advantage).
TOOLTIP.pcInitiative: Initiative is a D20 roll, with Dexterity modifier and class level as bonus. In combat, combatants act in initiative order. Initiative is determined once at the beginning of combat. You can choose to Delay your turn, taking no action and then act normally on whatever initiative count you decide to act. By doing this, you voluntarily reduce your initiative for the rest of the combat. Click to roll initiative (only useable if an encounter exists in Foundry's Combat Tracker).
TOOLTIP.pcLastGaspSaves: Some effects offer Last Gasp Saves instead of instantly affecting (or killing) a character. On their first turn while being affected by Last Gasp Saves, a character can take only one action (a Standard Action, Quick Action or moving). Afterwards, they roll a Hard save (16+). If this fails, they are now Helpless and can take no further actions except to roll more last gasp saves. Like for Death Saves, they now roll another Hard save (16+) at the beginning of each of their turns and a single success means the character has thrown off the condition and will act normally on their next turn, while a natural 20 means they can take their normal turn immediately. Failing four Last Gasp saves means the effect fully succeeds and the character turns to stone, is liquefied or whatever else they were saving against. An ally next to a character making Last Gasp saves can use a Standard Action to help shake off the effect, which allows the affected character to roll a bonus last gasp save that does not count against the four total if failed, and only requires a Normal save (11+).
TOOLTIP.pcName:
Character name (for example, "Helen") Consider the setting's lore and the character's upringing and backgrounds for inspiration. Does the character carry a title from a background?
Have they earned a funny nickname?
Maybe another player and you want to play siblings and share a last name? It's usually good to avoid recognizable names from real life and media. Examples:
Bobert the Barbarian
Bree "Apple" Goodbarrel
Shemra
Sir Richard Highhome
TOOLTIP.pcLevel:
Character level (from 1 to 10) Characters scale strongly by level. For example, each level increases Attack Bonus, number of Damage Dice, Skill Checks, Hit Points, Defenses, Initiative and number of Recovery Dice (but not Recoveries). Levels are divided into three tiers:
Levels 1 to 4 are considered Adventurer tier.
Levels 5 to 7 are considered Champion tier.
Levels 8 to 10 are considered Epic tier. Upon reaching a new tier, characters scale even more strongly, new options (like Champion or Epic tier feats) become available and the story threats usually become more far-reaching and dangerous as well.
TOOLTIP.pcRaceDesc: Provides a +2 bonus to one of your ability scores. The bonus can't be stacked with the class bonus. May also provide some additional powers. Your choice usually won't limit your class selection. Common choices are often Human, Dwarf, Elf, Gnome, Half Elf, Half Orc and Halfling. For other choices or mixed ancestry, talk to your GM.
TOOLTIP.pcRecoveries: Recoveries are used to restore Hit Points. Many powers, spells and potions grant uses of recoveries. Some grant Free Recoveries, which don't consume recoveries. Player characters can use a Standard Action to Rally and use one Recovery to regain lost Hit Points. A character that already rallied in a battle needs to pass a Normal save (11+) each time before they can rally again. If they fail, they retain their action but can't rally that turn. During a Quick Rest, you can choose to use as many recoveries as you have available. If you are Staggered, you must try to heal yourself using recoveries, spells or other means. When using a recovery, you roll a recovery die for each level and add the constitution modifier at the end, regaining this many HP. (The constitution bonus is doubled at Champion levels, and tripled at Epic levels.) The recovery die size and number of recoveries available depend on each class and can be improved by various talents and feats. If you take an action or are affected by something that requires a recovery but have none left, you get half the healing you would otherwise get and take a stacking -1 penalty to all defenses and attack rolls until your next Full Heal-Up. This is supported in Foundry as negative recoveries (you can set the number of remaining recoveries to -3, for example). A Full Heal-Up resets recoveries to full.
TOOLTIP.pcRestQuick: After each battle, you can use a quick rest. You can choose to heal yourself using as many recoveries as you have available. If you are Staggered (at half Hit Points or below) you must try to heal yourself, either with a recovery, a spell or by other means. For each recharge power you used in the last battle, roll to see if you recharge the power (roll a d20, meet or beat the recharge value). Foundry automatically rolls power recharge rolls and recoveries when staggered upon clicking Quick Rest.
TOOLTIP.pcRestFull:
After about four battles, you earned a full heal-up. Hit Points are reset to full.
All used Recoveries are regained.
All expended powers are regained or recharged (Daily powers are actually "per Full Heal-up").
If the party earned a Level-up, now is the time!
TOOLTIP.pcSaves:
Saves are a d20 roll with no standard modifiers against a difficulty class (DC) that you need to meet or beat. Saves are used for anything from power recharges to saves against effects to death saves. There are three DCs for saves, if a save doesn't specify a DC, it's a Normal save:
Easy (6+)
Normal (11+)
Hard (16+) There are no standard modifiers or bonuses to saves, but some talents, feats and items provide save bonuses.
TOOLTIP.macroEditorHint:
Use the field below to write a macro that executes when the power is used. Available variables are:

  • speaker: User activating the item.
  • actor: Actor that owns the item.
  • token: Active token for the actor that owns the item.
  • archmage: System-specifc data you can modify to implement custom automation that overrides the system's own.
TOOLTIP.hideSpellLevelsHint: Use the checkboxes next to each spell level to hide that level from chat if it's made redundant by a higher level version of the spell.
TOOLTIP.firstLevelHint: See the Hit and Effect fields in the Attack tab.
TOOLTIP.activeEffectsItemHint: Active Effects will not be applied directly to this item's parent actor, but they will show up as draggable effects on power cards in chat messages.
TOOLTIP.actionAttackHint: For ranged attacks, include either "R:" or "C:" in the action's name, above. For targeting, include possible targets in parentheses at the end of the attack line, such as "[[d20+9]] vs AC ([[d3]] nearby enemies)".
TOOLTIP.actionSpecialHint: Enter special attacks here. Use the top row of each field to specify the conditions (such as "Natural 16+") and the bottom row of each field to specify the effect (such as "[[20]] damage and 7 ongoing damage").

170.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.7.0! Here's a quick tour of new features
170.documentation: We have started the (long) process of writing documentation for the system. If you have documentation you want to contribute, please reach out or issue a Pull Request!
170.cards: We now have Card Support for Icon Relationship 5's and 6's - Please see the documentation for more info on how to enable and set this up
170.sheets: Character sheets have been reworked. Open one up to check it out!
170.showItem: You can now show an Item to all players with a new 'Show to Players' button
170.iconRelationships: Rolling Icon Relationships now has a nicer Chat display, along with Disengage and Save checks
170.monstersCompendium: There is now a system-provided Monsters Compendium
170.generalFeats: Along with General Feats, courtesy of the Community!
170.end: There's a variety of bug fixes and minor tweaks as well, such as to Trigger automation. Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

180.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.8.0! Here's a quick tour of new features
180.monkCompendium: The Monk compendium is back up and available to use! Monk forms come preloaded with groups, so checkout the manual group sorting option on monk character sheets! Go jab, punch, and kick your way to victory!
180.escalationDie: The Escalation die is now manually adjustable, and via a new System Setting can even go past 9000! (6 is the default max)
180.tierShorthand: Thanks to LegoFed3, there is now a @tier shorthand for Actors. Tier is the multiplier for each tier (1x adv, 2x cha, 3x epic)
180.end: There's a variety of bug fixes and minor tweaks as well, such as multi-class health calculations and various compendium updates. Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

190.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.9.0! Here's a quick tour of new features
190.aip: Added basic support for the Autocomplete Inline Properties (https://foundryvtt.com/packages/autocomplete-inline-properties/) module, if enabled.
190.necromancer: The Necromancer compendium is back up and available to use! Go Raise Hell!
190.colorblind: Thanks to EndlesNights, we now have colorblind options. Check out the System Settings - powers should be much clearer for colorblind players!
190.baseStats: HP, AC, Damage dice, and more are now optionally calculated automatically based on your Class. Huge thanks to LegoFed3 for this!
190.inlineRoll: All Power Compendiums should now have inline Rolls. Thanks to everyone in the community who helped!
190.inlineRollDocs: We now have additional documentation for inline Rolls in the Reference dialog!
190.systemDocs: Our System documentation has been expanded even further, and is now in Gitbooks for a better experience
190.chatCards: Ability / Background checks now have a new Chat Card layout that includes useful information such as "Background used". The Icon Roll Chat Cards got a makeover as well - roll the dice and see what the Icons bring!
190.end: There's a variety of bug fixes and minor tweaks as well, such as fixing powers in the Compendiums, adding Weakling / Elite to creature sizes, negative recovery logic, and more. Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

1100.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.10.0! Here's a quick tour of new features
1100.v2Sheet: We've redesigned the character sheet! The overall structure is the same, but everything that's rollable will now have a blue d20 near it, and the sheet will feel more responsive. If you prefer the original sheet, you can return to the original sheet per character by clicking the "Sheet" settings gear in the header of the sheet window.
1100.nightMode: The new character sheet has a night mode! Click the tab on the sheet and find it near the bottom of the right sidebar.
1100.rolls: Many more areas of the sheet are now rollable, such as initiative, death saves, icon rolls, and more. Watch out for a blue icon to find rollable links!
1100.iconRolls: Icon rolls are now stored on the sheet! You can also click an icon result icon to cycle through 5, 6, and empty results.
1100.rests: The sheet now supports both quick rests and full heal-ups! Find them in the new resources section of the character sheet directly above powers.
1100.powerImporter: The power importer has been redesigned! The new design is much closer to a character builder, and will pull from any classes and races detected on your character sheet.
1100.end: There's also a variety of bug fixes and minor tweaks added to the system! Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

1170.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.17.0! We have some important changes for critical hits in this release.
1170.crits: Crits no longer double damage automatically.. Instead, each target that was critted against will be bold in the chat card. We've also added offensive and defensive crit modifiers as new settings within character sheets, and we've added an Active Effect to the vulnerable condition.
1170.compendia: We have several corrections to existing compendia entries, and we've added magic items from the SRD!
1170.end: There's also a variety of bug fixes and minor tweaks added to the system! You can read the full release notes here. Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

1190.welcome: Welcome to 13th Age System version 1.19.0! We have some big changes for NPCs including a new sheet and updated compendiums!
1190.end: You can read the full release notes here. Come join us in the Foundry Discord #13th-age channel for questions and feedback!

npc.welcome: We've updated the NPC sheet to a new design! The original NPC sheet is still available and can be switched to by setting the sheet to the "Legacy NPC Sheet".
npc.init: NPC initiative no longer includes the NPC's level. Now, NPC initiative will use the exact value you enter, and we've included a migration to update all of your actors, tokens, and compendiums to account for it.
npc.header: The header now includes flavor text and a cleaner presentation for its fields. Some fields in the header have to be clicked to edit them.
npc.attributes: Attributes are now in a row directly below the header and above the NPC sheet tabs. These include defenses and hit points as before, but now there are two new columns for Saves and Disengage checks that work the same as they do on the PC character sheet.
npc.compact: There's also a small arrow in the bottom right corner of the NPC sheet header (just below the NPC's avatar) that puts the sheet into a compact mode by reducing the size of the header and attributes and hiding some items less important for play such as flavor text. This is handled as a flag per actor, so it will persist between page reloads.
npc.details: The NPC's biography! This field always existed, but we never had a place for it before. We're likely going to expand this section to include other long text fields like battle tactics, story hooks, and icons.
npc.actions:
Actions, Traits, and Nastier Specials now work similar to how Powers work on character sheets.
  • All three types support avatars (including chat)!
  • Actions are summarized and can be expanded on click.
  • Inline rolls display in a new summarized format, such as +8+LVL+ED.
npc.effects: These work exactly like they do for character sheets! Conditions and custom effects will show up here and can be created, edited, or removed right from the sheet.
npc.modifyLevel:
The modify level tab includes a slider that lets you adjust the level of the monster within the constraints allowed by the core rules (+/- 6, min 0, max 15). Clicking confirm will create a copy of the monster, and the new monster will appear in your world's actor directory. The system will make a best effort calculation to change the NPC's stats, attacks, and damage.

This feature is experimental, and we're looking forward to improving it with feedback on what works and what doesn't!
npc.settings: As with the character sheet, settings have been moved into their own tab. This currently only includes visual information such as the avatar settings and the ability to switch the NPC sheet to night mode, but we'll likely expand this in the future with additional settings!

1190.compendiums: SRD Monster Compendiums have been updated to include inline rolls for most use cases. There have been a few outliers that slipped through the cracks, but virtually every monster in the SRD compendium was updated to have inline rolls added for their targeting lines and their damage. This only applies to monsters in the compendium.
